trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with IdeaScale | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with IdeaScale | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use IdeaScale with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use IdeaScale with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and IdeaScale.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and IdeaScale.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A IdeaScale single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A IdeaScale single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to IdeaScale will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to IdeaScale will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for IdeaScale
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for IdeaScale

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for IdeaScale.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for IdeaScale.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type IdeaScale.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type IdeaScale.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select IdeaScale, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select IdeaScale, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>IdeaScale</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>IdeaScale</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to IdeaScale with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to IdeaScale with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for IdeaScale requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for IdeaScale requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the IdeaScale application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the IdeaScale application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to IdeaScale page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to IdeaScale page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the IdeaScale Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your IdeaScale application (e.g.: "https://company.IdeaScale.com"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the IdeaScale Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your IdeaScale application (e.g.: "https://company.IdeaScale.com"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at IdeaScale page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at IdeaScale page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your IdeaScale company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your IdeaScale company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Community Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Community Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Community Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Community Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Security \> Single Signon Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Security \> Single Signon Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Signon Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Signon Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Single-Signon Type, select SAML 2.0.
trans-unit.target: As Single-Signon Type, select SAML 2.0.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Signon Type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Signon Type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Signon Settings dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Signon Settings dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Signon Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Signon Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at IdeaScale dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the SAML IdP Entity ID textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at IdeaScale dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the SAML IdP Entity ID textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the content of your downloaded metadata file, and then paste it into the SAML IdP Metadata textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the content of your downloaded metadata file, and then paste it into the SAML IdP Metadata textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at IdeaScale dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout Success URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at IdeaScale dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout Success URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into IdeaScale, they must be provisioned into IdeaScale.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into IdeaScale, they must be provisioned into IdeaScale.

trans-unit.source: In the case of IdeaScale, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of IdeaScale, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your IdeaScale company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your IdeaScale company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Community Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Community Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Community Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Community Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Basic Settings \> Member Management.
trans-unit.target: Go to Basic Settings \> Member Management.

trans-unit.source: Click Add Member.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Member.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Member Management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Member Management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add New Member section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add New Member section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add New Member</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add New Member</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email Addresses textbox, type the email address of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email Addresses textbox, type the email address of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email with a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email with a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other IdeaScale user account creation tools or APIs provided by IdeaScale to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other IdeaScale user account creation tools or APIs provided by IdeaScale to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the IdeaScale **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the IdeaScale **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
